title: How to Fix Personal Hotspot Not Showing Up on iPhone

steps.title: Double-check that Hotspot is turned on.
steps.content: Double-check that Hotspot is turned on. Also, make sure the password is correct when sharing with others. Do the following: Open Settings . Tap Personal Hotspot . Toggle on Allow Others to Join . If this is already turned on, toggle it off and then on again.
Whether it's your iPhone that won't show your Hotspot or someone else's, restarting your device can usually fix simple software bugs.

steps.title: You must have working cellular data to use Hotspot.
steps.content: You must have working cellular data to use Hotspot. Sometimes, toggling this feature off and on can get it working again. Do the following: Open Settings . Tap Cellular . Toggle off Cellular . Toggle on Cellular .
If a Hotspot network isn't popping up, make sure both devices are on and within range of each other. Try connecting with both devices side-by-side.

steps.title: Disable Low Power mode.
steps.content: Disable Low Power mode. This feature reduces some functions to optimize performance. However, it may affect your Hotspot. To turn off Low Power mode , do the following: Open Settings . Tap Battery . Toggle off Low Power Mode .

Carrier updates are a bit more rare, but it's possible you may have a new update available. [1] X Research source To manually update your carrier settings, do the following: Open Settings . Tap General . Tap About . If there's an update available, you'll see it next to Carrier update .

steps.title: Keep your iPhone up-to-date.
steps.content: Keep your iPhone up-to-date . Similar to when your iPhone experiences other issues, you may be due for a software update. Do the following: Go to Settings . Tap General . Tap Software Update . Tap Download and Install .

Keep in mind this will also erase any saved Wi-Fi networks and cellular settings, so you'll need to set those up again later. [2] X Research source Open Settings . Tap General . Tap Transfer or Reset iPhone . Tap Reset . Tap Reset Network Settings .

steps.title: Contact Apple support for help.
steps.content: Contact Apple support for help. This may be a hardware issue, and you may still be covered by Apple's warranty. [3] X Research source You can contact Apple on their website at https://getsupport.apple.com/ .
